Around Jan 26th (date and location unclear) police beat up a woman because the fitness certificate of her car had expired.
On Jan 26, a Palestinian father and son were injured while they were working in a farm in Dayr Istiya, north of Salfit, when they were attacked by a settler with an axe.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2012-) Security Belt Forces
notes: On 26 January, Security Belt Forces reportedly opened fire on a car that attempted to flee a security checkpoint in Al Mahfad district, northeast of Abyan governorate, southern Yemen. The car subsequently hit a roadblock. 2 civilian passengers died in the accident and 1 other was injured.
Haitham Abdulrahman Saeed al-Siddiq, identified as a petroleum engineer, was shot and killed by three unidentified gunmen in the Mudhaffar area of Taiz city.

actor1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
notes: On 26 Jan, BSF troops fired on an alleged Pakistani intruder (assumed civilian) along the WB at Chak Fakira in Samba district (J&K). The man was hospitalised with serious injuries.

On January 26, a youth hurled a bomb at the car of the BJD youth president of Dharmasala block, while travelling near Nakapul village (Jajpur, Odisha). The victim sustained injuries in his right hand and was admitted to Dharmasala Community Health Centre (CHC). It is suspected that previous enmity might be the reason behind the attack.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
assoc_actor_2: Health Workers (Burkina Faso); Aid Workers (Burkina Faso); CSSI: International Health Support Center
notes: On January 26, presumed Ansaroul Islam (JNIM) militants seized a vehicle of the NGO CSSI and abducted two staff members including a nurse and a driver in the area of Bourzanga.
On January 26, a woman went missing in Midebdo, she was found beheaded on the outskirts of the village on January 29.
26 January. Police and the local chief tied-up and tortured a man in Butamuheba. They held the man over night while they tortured him to confess to impregnating a woman.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 26 January (on or around). The body of a CNDD-FDD member was discovered in Busimba. The victim's arms and tongue had been cut off.

actor1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
notes: 26 January. After fleeing Bambari, UPC fighters killed two civilians in Yamalet (no coordinates available), 30 km from Bambari along the Bambari-Balaka road.
26 January. Mayi Mayi raped three women in Kwebo (no coordinates available; located in the Masisi territory).
26 January. Unknown gunmen in police and military uniforms (assumed as state forces) stormed a football viewing centre in Birnin Magaji and abducted seven people.
26 January. A police officer was shot dead in Benin city by unknown gunmen. The victim was on his way home and off-duty.

On 26 January 2019, in Tha Mee Hla Village, in Rathedaung Township, in Rakhine State, the Myanmar military 99th LID raided a village. They fired into the village, injuring two women and a child who later died. Many homes were hit with artillery shells and bullets. The Myanmar military ordered some villagers out of their homes and beat them. The gold, cash, jewelry and mobile phones of the villagers were looted.

On 26 Jan 2019, in Tuyen Quang province, a man, armed with a rock hammer, attacked a journalist from the Vietnam News Agency (VNA), who was reporting on the illegal exploitation of lead and zinc in the northern province.

As reported on January 27, a RJD leader was killed in Sripur village under Cheria-Bariyarpur police station area (Begusarai, Bihar). His body was found near a brick kiln on January 26 by family members. The reason behind the murder is unknown.

26 January. Raia Mutomboki Kokodikoko and Raia Mutomboki Ngandu looted Tachinid, Shabunda (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The assailants killed a man during the attack.

On Jan 26, the dead body of a suspected rapist was found in outside Boltala village, Shaulakania Union (Jhalokati, Barisal) killed by unidentified vigilantes. He had disappeared on Jan 22. A confessional statement was found hanging around the victim's neck. He is one of four supects in connection with the rape and murder of a 18-year-old female garment worker was found dead in her house on January 7. The fourth suspect was shot dead in a gunfight with the police on Jan 29 in Chittagong.

Assumed on January 26, a villager was killed by a group of Communist Party of India-Maoist (CPI-Maoist) cadres after being abducted in Jaravandi village under Etapalli tehsil area (Gadchiroli, Maharashtra), over suspicion of being a police informer. He was found dead on January 27.
Around 26 Jan 2019, in Bangkok, a Vietnamese blogger for Radio Free Asia (RFA) appeared to have gone missing after applying for asylum at the UN Refugee Agency.

Since 26 January 2019, a popular blogger has been missing since he fled his home in Da Nang. It is surmised that he was abducted for imprisonment and interrogation. Sources claim the blogger sought asylum in Thailand on 25 January 2019 at the UNHCR in Bangkok, but the Thai government says it has no record of him entering the country.
YPG forces carried out a campaign of arrests in the city of Shadadah with the purpose of forcing men into military service.
Ahrar al Sharqiyah fighters beat up an old man in the Ma'btali sub-district after he refused to give them a royalty of 8 tanks of olive oil or its cash equivalent.
Ahrar al Sharqiyah fighters stabbed three young displaced men from Eastern Ghouta on al Villat Street in the city of Afrin. The reason for the stabbing remains unclear. No fatalities were reported.
Unidentified gunmen beat up the chairman of the "Qalamoun towns committee" in the city of Afrin and stole his money, laptop, and other possessions as well.
Turkish border guards shot and killed 1 woman and injured several others as they tried to cross into Turkey from the Darkosh area.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)

25 January. 5 students are abducted from a secondary school near Natcho in Bamenda by an unidentified armed group, Cameroon government officials and Ambazonian separatists blame each other for the ongoing abductions.
25 January. 2 Lawyers are abducted in Buea near Mile 16 neighborhood by an unidentified armed group. Cameroon government officials and Ambazonian separatists blame each other for ongoing abductions.

January 24-January 25. Boko Haram attack Ngosi and Toufou of Mayo Tsanaga, leaving 1 woman injured, 193 burned huts, two rocket-destroyed classrooms, one health center destroyed, and 6 shops broken into, as well as food, an ambulance and drugs stolen.

January 24-January 25. Boko Haram attack Ngosi and Toufou of Mayo Tsanaga, leaving 1 woman injured, 193 burned huts, two rocket-destroyed classrooms, one health center destroyed, and 6 shops broken into, as well as food, an ambulance and drugs stolen.
January 24-January 25. Boko Haram attack Kerawa of Kolofata, killing one civilian.

25 January. A train from Ngaoundere going to Younde at Goyoum station is attacked by an unidentified armed group as it is leaving the station. Shots were fired at the train cars, but no injuries were reported.
On January 25, a Dozo shot dead two civilians and wounded three others in the village of Bingo in the area of Monimpebougou (coded as Monimpebougou at geoprecision 2).
25 January. Bassa militias attacked Tudu Uku village and killed three residents. A military man and civil defence officers were injured. Militias burnt seven houses, cars and motorcycles.
On January 25th, mourners gathered in Khartoum to commemorate the death of two people in demonstrations the previous day. Security forces (coded as police) fired tear gas at the crowds.
On January 25th, police used tear gas and live rounds against cannabis users in Kabale town, arresting five. There were no reports of injuries.
Around Jan 25th (date not specified), two Bulawayo women were beaten by soldiers and police and then forced to perform unprotected intercourse with a security guard.
On 25-January-2019, 2 civilians were killed and 4 were wounded by unidentified armed militants in the Chashma Shir area of Aybak district, Samangan province.
On 25 January, anti-Houthi forces reportedly shot a civilian, injuring him, in the Ar Ramiyah are of As Sukhnah district, east of Al Hudaydah city, western Yemen.
On Jan 25, a jubo league activist was killed and his brother sustained injuries in an armed attack by unidentified militants in Rothkhola area of Kishoreganj, Dhaka.

On 25 January, a BJP councillor from Ward 8 of Ludhiana (Ludhiana, Punjab) and several other accomplices allegedly attacked a youth with a knife in the Div. 3 police station. No reason was given for the attack, which the councillor refuted.

On January 25, in Cherpu village in Thrissur tehsil (Thrissur, Kerala), unidentified actors, believed to by right-wing activists, assaulted director Priyanandan after he made a social media post on the Sabarimala issue.
On January 25, Kakrali police allegedly tortured a brick kiln owner in Kakrali village (Gujrat, Punjab), resulting in his death in custody.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Barangay Sampaloc, Talavera town, Nueva Ecija province on January 25, 2019.

Around Jan 25th (exact date not specified), the journalist Amede Aboubakar, jailed in the Mueda military base, was reportedly denied food, repeatedly beaten and made to sleep in handcuffs.
25 January. Police forces beat a civilian for loitering, he died in custody the same day.
25 January. Residents of Phomolong village in Welkom, fatally stabbed a man who allegedly stabbed his wife.
On Jan 25th, a machete and knobkerrie wielding gang besieged a night spot in Zhombe and randomly attacekd people in the bar. One person was killed, several others remained injured.

On 25 January, four people attacked a Scheduled Caste family in Chabacha Kalan village of Solan district (Solan, Himachal Pradesh) with cudgels, apparently over a land dispute, leaving several of the victims seriously injured.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

25 January. Nyatura Niyonzimana abducted one man from Karambi and looted his home.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 25 January. An unidentified armed group killed a man in Kitalaga, Kalehe (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map).

25 January: In East Welega zone, Sasiga woreda, two members of Ethiopian military forces broke into a civilian's house at night and raped a woman. They were brought before court three weeks later and sentenced to 14 years in prison
A suspect was arrested by rebel forces in the town of Al Bab after a motorcycle IED killed and injured several people.
YPG forces carried out a campaign of arrests in the city of Shadadah with the purpose of forcing men into military service.
On January 24, unknown gunmen abducted two civilians in Kacham.
January 24 (night of). Boko Haram attack the presbytery in Mangirlda, leaving at least three priests killed, including an American, and 12 others injured. Populations arrested three assailants.

actor1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
notes: 24 January. A drunken UPC soldier opened fire on civilians at a funeral in the Djama-Yakania neighborhood of Ippy. 13 civilians were killed and approximately 20 others were shot and injured (other sources indicate a greater number of casualties).
24 January. An Anti-Balaka group killed three civilians, including a woman and child, along a road near Alindao.

24 January (on or before). ADF forces ambushed drivers on RN 4, in Kisiki-Mayimoya. Three people were killed, two were injured. Three Okapi vehicles were also intercepted but the drivers were not harmed.
24 January: Police killed a suspected thief. The residents insisted he was an innocent man who was a victim of extrajudicial killing
24 January. Dahalo abducted and killed of a businessman along with cattle in Ambohimahasoa of Vondrozo. A clash ensued later on (coded separately).
24 January. Unknown armed men kidnapped the APC candidate for the Edo State House of Assembly, Mr Michael Ohio-Ezomon at his house in Eme-Ora

24 January. Suspected AS fighters carried out a hit and run attack on the District Commissioner's residence in Howlwadag District. The attack started with a hand grenade followed by heavy machine guns.
On January 24th, three armed men (wearing military uniforms) killed a farmer near Karu village (coordinates for Tawila, North Darfur, used). There is no further information.
On January 24th, unknown gunmen killed a man as he was gathering firewood near Katur (North Darfur). There is no further information.
Around Jan 24th (date not specified), police shot at two people from Sesheke, as they refused to take part in PF rallies.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On 24 January, pro-Houthi snipers reportedly shot a civilian woman in front of her house in Taif area of Ad Durayhimi district, south of Al Hudaydah city, western Yemen, injuring her.

On 24 January, anti-Houthi forces reportedly opened fire on Al Manakh water station in Al Mudhaffar district, northwest of Taizz city, central Yemen, killing a child while getting water from the station.
On Jan 24, a jubo league leader was stabbed to death by unidentfied man following a quarrel in Noapara municipality, Abhaynagar (Jessore, Khulna).

On Jan 24, a government official was found dead in Mirpur (Dhaka) a night after he went missing. The injuries on body show that he was tortured before he died. The culprits behind the attack are unknown.
On January 24, a Rashtriya Janata Dal leader was shot dead by unidentified armed men in Janardanpur village in Kalyanpur area (Samastipur, Bihar).

On January 24, in Kuthuparamba town (Kannur, Kerala), armed CPM workers attacked a group of Congress workers during a festival at the Kuttisasthappan Temple for unknown reasons, leaving several Congress workers with serious stab injuries.
As reported on January 24, an armed man shot dead a person over a property dispute in Ferozewala town (Sheikhupura, Punjab).
On January 24, Timber Market Association president and his sons shot at and injured a PTI member of the Sindh Assembly in Lyari town (Karachi, Sindh), reportedly over a dispute about water supply.
On January 24, unknown gunmen broke into the house of a trader in Bamako, robbing and killing him.

Members of the NPA burned heavy equipment owned by Pacific Summit Construction Group at Barangay Maragondon, Real town, Quezon province on January 24, 2019. Workers of the construction company were held at gunpoint on site as the NPA burned the equipment.

On January 24, armed men from Khuhro community shot dead a man from Narejo community in Burira village near Naudero town (Larkana, Sindh), over an old dispute between Bhutto and Khuhro communities relating to 3200 acre of lands.
24 January. The ADF ambushed an Okapi Logistics, NGO convoy near Kisiki. The assailants killed three and injured three during the robbery.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

Asayish forces shot and killed a young man while in pursuit in Mansura town in Ar-Raqqa province.
23 January. A teacher at Polytechnic school is abducted in Bambui by 3 from an unidentified armed group.
Week of January 23. Boko Haram attack the border town of Fotokol, killing 3 civilians.
23 January. Charles Kakule's militia abducted 30 fishermen on Lake Edward. Some of the abductees managed to escape, while the others were released following ransom payments.
23 January: In Muruka village, a civilian was shot and wounded by a police officer who was mad after his favourite football team lost. He later died in the hospital

23 January. Ethiopian nationals were shot by unknown assailants. Some dead and injured (fatalities coded at low estimate of 3).
23 January. Mursade Clan militias shot and killed some family members from Hawadle clan over land issues (fatalities coded at low estimate of 3).
23 January. SLP in Buroa fired several bullets into the air to stop a clash between two groups over a land dispute. Some people were injured by stray bullets.
23 January. Two armed men, suspected to be either AS or IS elements, shot and killed a young businessman in Bakara.

On January 23rd, unknown gunmen (wearing military uniforms) attacked Kura village in Jebel Moon (coordinates for Kuru Kuru, West Darfur, used at prec 2), killing two civilians. The attackers stole 180 head of cattle and torched 47 dwellings.

On January 23rd, five people (at least four of whom were Acholi) were attacked and wounded by a Madi miltia using basic hand weapons, in the village of Goro B in the disputed area of Apaa. 14 huts were also looted and then torched by the militia. Displacement has been mounting in the area as a result of the unrest.

On Jan 23, a number of Khader High School students suffered from tear gas fired by Israeli soldiers into its yard. The attack led to suffocation of several students and caused the school to be evacuated.
On Jan 23, Israeli forces opened fire at Palestinian fishermen off the northern Gaza coast. No injuries were reported.
On January 23, a street vendor was reported to be beaten up by the Police Forces who seized his hawkers unlawfully, in Konak, Izmir city.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council

actor1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
notes: On Jan 23, Indian Border Security Force (BSF) allegedly shot dead a Bangladeshi cattle trader along Char Ashariadaha border in Godagari upazila, Rajshahi. The forces attacked the cattle trader when he crossed the border jurisdiction.

On January 23, in Pinarayi village in Thalassery Tehsil (Kannur, Kerala), BJP workers attacked four CPI(M) workers with a bomb for unknown reasons, leaving four CPI(M) with serious injuries.

On January 23, in Pinarayi village in Thalassery Tehsil (Kannur, Kerala), CPI(M) workers attacked BJP workers with a bomb in retaliation for an attack on CPI(M) workers earlier, leaving three BJP workers seriously injured.

At an unspecified time (though likely in late January), gunmen from Tonj East abducted three children from an unspecified location in the disputed Gok state (coordinates for Cueibet, Lakes state, used), and stole 150 head of cattle.

QSD forces carried out raids and arrests in the towns and villages of the southern countryside of Shadadah town in Al-Hasakeh in search of IS sleeper cells allegedly responsible for the explosive attack on checkpoint 47.
The body of a man was found near the electricity department of Abu Kasha in the vicinity of Maryamyn in the countryside of Jisr-Ash-Shugur in Idleb, having been killed under unknown circumstances.

On January 22, unknown gunmen abducted an elderly man in the area of Tonou (coded as Tondo Erkokoni at geoprecision 2).

On Jan 22nd, members of the Zimbabwe National Army beat up vendors in Gweru accusing them of illegally operating on the streets and participating in protests over fuel price hikes.

On Jan 22nd, members of the Zimbabwe Defense Forces and the Zimbabwe Republic Police went door to door in Bulawayo suburb of Mabuthweni forcing all males to come out, making them lie down and then beating them with baton sticks and fan belts.

On Jan 22nd, the military and police of assaulted 28 people who were receiving treatment in a non-profit hospital after suffering severe injuries in previous beatings. After assaulting them, they detained people at Harare Central.
On Jan 22, Israeli forces opened fire on farmers in eastern Gaza who were working on their lands. They were forces to leave their lands but no injuries were reported.
On Jan 22, Israeli forces opened fire on farmers in southern Gaza who were working on their lands. They were forces to leave their lands but no injuries were reported.
On Jan 22, Israeli forces opened fire on fishermen off the coast of Gaza forcing fishing boasts to return to shore but no injuries were reported.

On Jan 21st, unknown gunmen attacked Maganja village, 7km from the Anadarko camp developing the gas liquification plants. Two people were killed. Four houses, several kiosks and a minibus were burned.

On January 16, police allegedly tortured a suspect accused of theft, resulting in his death in Pahrianwali town (Mandi Bahauddin, Punjab).
As reported on January 16, unidentified armed men opened fire at HESCO officials during an operation to remove illegally installed transformers in Sakrand town (Shaheed Benazirabad, Sindh).
A drug suspect was shot and killed during a police raid at Barangay Ibabang Iyam, Lucena City, Quezon province on January 16, 2019.
A drug suspect was shot and killed during a police raid at Barangay New Lower Bicutan, Taguig City, Metro Manila on January 16, 2019.
A drug suspect was shot and killed during a police raid at Barangay Maharlika, Taguig City, Metro Manila on January 16, 2019.
On 16 Jan 2019, in Ban Klong Haeng village, tambon Khao Phanom, Khao Phanom district, Krabi province, a woman was shot and killed by two gunmen hiding on the plantation next to their house.
16 January. A man and his son were stabbed to death in Butaganzwa. Local leaders suspect they were killed over a land dispute.
16 January. Unidentified gunmen on motorcycles shot and killed a team member of the investigative journalist Anas Aremeyaw Anas in Accra.

On January 16th, security forces (some who were plan-clothes officers (recorded as UAG), and one wearing a military uniform, recorded as army) forced their way into the house of a journalist in Omdurman, after threatening to fire tear gas into it. After the journalist let the men in, they beat her in front of her children.
On Jan 16th, on the third day of protests against fuel price hikes, reports of police and soldiers going door to door in Harare and Bulawayo beating people up.
On Jan 16th, on the third day of protests against fuel price hikes, reports of police and soldiers going door to door in Harare and Bulawayo beating people up.

On Jan 16th, on the third day of protests against fuel price hikes, police and soldiers went door to door in Mabvuku, Kuwaduana and Marondera of Mashonaland beating people up and forcing them to remove barricades in the streets.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 16 January. Imbonerakure assaulted and detained a school director in Gasenyi until a ransom was paid.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 16 January. Imbonerakure assaulted the chief in Nyakibari. The perpetrators were later arrested.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 16 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a man with clubs in his home in Mugimbu. They targeted the man over witchcraft accusations.

On Jan 16th, on the last day of a stay-at-home strike over a hike in fuel prices, police fired teargas to disperse a crowd queuing for bread at a shopping center near central Harare. No fatalities have been reported.
On January 16, in Mandsaur town (Mandsaur, MP), unknown persons killed a BJP-affiliated man for unknown reasons.
On Jan 16th, in Epworth, during protests over fuel hikes, soldiers assaulted a 38-year-old man heading home.

Between 13-16 Jan, in Madurai district (TN), a minor accused of theft charges was picked up by the police (13 Jan) where he was allegedly tortured and taken in illegal custody until Jan 16. He succumbed to his injuries on 24 Jan.
On 16 January, 2019, members of an unidentified militant group shot and killed one citizen while injuring another in Tarik Ibn Ziad city.
YPG forces carried out a campaign of arrests in the town of Shadadah with the purpose of forced conscription.
YPG forces carried out a campaign of arrests of teachers in the town of Al-Hasakeh with the purpose of forced conscription.
On 15 January 2019, the body of a young man who had been beheaded was found near the roundabout in the town of Thiban.
On 15 January 2019, the body of a young man was found mutilated near a railway on the outskirts of the town of Basira.
Unidentified gunmen, likely to be pro regime militants, entered a shop in the Al-Joura-Al-Thawra neighborhood of Deir-ez-Zor city and killed a young man.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie
notes: On January 15, Burkinabe forces reportedly summarily executed seven civilians in a hamlet between Tanwalbougou and Piega.

notes: On January 15, Burkinabe forces reportedly summarily executed five civilians in the area of Pama.

actor1: Military Forces of Morocco (1999-) Auxiliary Forces
notes: On 15 january 2019, a journalist was brutally assaulted by a member of the Auxiliary Forces in Casablanca while performing his professional duty of covering of the fire on a public transportation bus.
On Jan 15th, reports that police beat people venturing outside their homes in Bulawayo. Violent protests were held in the town over fuel price hikes the same day.
On Jan 15th, a number (not specified) of Harare men were abducted from their homes by masked men in plain clothes carrying AK47 rifles.
On Jan 15th, reports that police beat people venturing outside their homes in Harare. Violent protests were held in the capital over fuel price hikes the day before.

On Jan 15, Israeli forces opened fire at a group of Palestinian youths for allegedly attempting to cross the security fence along the Israeli-Gaza border, east of Gaza city. 4 were reportedly shot and injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: A police officer severely beat a child in front of Saba Private Highschool because the child quarreled with the officers son.

actor1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force

On January 15, two villagers were shot dead by Naxals on suspicion of being police informers at Gurudbad village in Chakai police station area (Jamui, Bihar). Around 25 Naxals reached the village, barged into their houses, beaten them up and then shot them dead.

Around 15 January, villagers claim they were thrashed by police in Fazilka city (Fazilka, Punjab) who accused them of planning to abandon cattle in the town. However, the villagers claim they were bringing stray cows to a gaushala (shelter) when police beat them and detained one of them.
On January 15, in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Telangana), two unidentified armed actors killed a TDP leader for unknown reasons.
Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Barangay Malanang, Opol town, Misamis Oriental province on January 15, 2019.

actor1: Islamic State (Greater Sahara) and/or Ansaroul Islam
notes: On January 15, JNIM and/or ISGS militants attacked the village of Gasseliki and killed eight people and wounded two others.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
notes: On January 15, presumed JNIM and/or ISGS militants attacked the mining site of Tiabongou and abducted Kirk Woodman, a Canadaian national and Vice President of Progress Minerals. His body was found the next day between Salmossi and Beiga, nearly 200km from the site of the abduction

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 15 January (on or before). The body of an Imbonerakure member, who worked for the aviation authority, was discovered in Bujumbura. The victim appeared to have been strangled to death.

15 January. An unidentified armed group kidnaps 36 people from a bus on the road from Buea to Kumba at Ediki in the South West region. Ambazonian seperatists blame the government while the government blames the seperatists for the kidnapping. Passengers were released the same day without their possessions.
15 January. Unknown gunmen fired shots at a taxi on the RN3 road from Conakry to Boke at Tanene, injuring a passenger.

On January 15, presumed ISGS militants attacked the village of In-Ekar Ouest, seven MSA militiamen were killed in battle before the militants executed eighteen civilians of the Dawasahak community. Fatalities split between events.

On January 15, presumed ISGS militants attacked the village of Taraterit (Taghatert), three MSA militiamen were killed in battle before the militants executed nine civilians of the Dawasahak community. Fatalities split between events.
15 January. A Tutsi was abducted from Ngozi by unknown perpetrators on 15/01. His body was discovered in Kayanza on 16/01. Local sources suspect the victim was targeted due to his ethnicity.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 - 31 January. During the month of January, 44 people from the Kiwanja area were kidnapped, including 11 children. The abductions are carried out by armed groups and criminals who seek ransoms. Most of the abductions target women. Coded as one VAC event each week of January.

actor1: Police Forces of Turkey (2016-) Prison Guards
notes: On January 15, a prisoner of Tekirdag F Type prison, in the outskirts of the Gunduzlu in Tekirdag, was heavily beaten up by the prison guards as he greeted another prisoner during his transfer to the courthouse.
15 January. The Raia Mutomboki Shukuru abducted three men from Kashewe, Kalehe. The assailants also looted live stock.

During the month of January, several Lou Nuer traditional leaders (most likely alongside civilians) were attacked by a Murle group in the area of Likuangole (Jonglei state), as they were attempting to deliver food. Several killed including two assistant chiefs (unknown fatalities coded as 10). There are no further details.
YPG arrested 9 young men in Quamishli in al-Hasakeh for forced conscription.
An unidentified armed group shot and injured a civilian in As-Sanamyn in Dar'a. No fatalities were reported.
14 January (on or before). A body was discovered in Bugiga, the victim had been tied up and strangled. According to locals, the body had not been deceased long as it had no signs of swelling.
14 January: In Keffa zone, SNNP region, atleast 37 people of kambata ethnic group living in the zone were killed by unidentified ethnic militia.

14 January. 4 people from an unidentified armed group abducts the Australian honourary consul along with his daughter and driver in Antsiranana, Diana. The daughter and driver were released the same day; the consul was rescued by police on the 19th

On or before January 14th, raiders (suspected of coming from Western Lakes state) attacked a village in Murkwich boma, Wulu county (coordinates for Wullu, Lakes state, used). A woman was killed and a 17 year-old girl injured. Cows stolen. 14 people have been arrested in connection with the incident.

actor1: Military Forces of Tanzania (1964-) Wildlife Force
notes: On Jan 14th, in Katavi, wildlife officers used fire arms against villagers who were allegedly invading the wild animals' tunnel at Kapalamsenga ward. One person was killed, three injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: Pro-Houthi forces reportedly opened fire on a civilian bus in the chekpoint of Al-Haykal in Dhi Naim district of Al-Bayda governorate, central Yemen, killing a woman and injuring others. The reason behind the incident is unclear.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: Houthi forces burnt a civilian straw house in Al-Zaribah area of Al Hudaydah governorate, after severely beating the civilian in front of his family's members.

Unidentified gunmen reportedly opened fire on two citizens while they were in their car in Al-Hawtah area of Shibam district in Hadramawt governorate, eastern Yemen, killing one of them and injuring the other.

On 14 Jan, in Vannarpannai area of Jaffna city (Jaffna, Northern), a group of armed youth assaulted devotees of Thai Pongal festival resulting to several injured persons. The reason for the incident is unknown.

On January 14, suspected BJP members attacked the family of a CPI-M member and his house, in Magurchhara village near Sabroom city (South Tripura, Tripura). There had been several attacks in the state against members of opposition parties.

On 14 January, the newly elected sarpanch and 13 others allegedly attacked his election opponent with sharp edged weapons and fired at the man, in Noordi Khurd area of Tarn Taran (Tarn Taran, Punjab). The SAD backed candidate had apparently tied with the Congress backed candidate with 99 votes each, but won the seat on a coin toss. The SAD workers deny the story.

On January 14, a civilian was assaulted by patrolling police officers in Galkot Municipality near Baglung city (Baglung district, Dhaualagiri). The victim sustained injury as a result of the incident.

On January 14, armed men shot dead a man over a land dispute in Pahar Khel Pacca village (Lakki Marwat, KP).
On January 14, armed men attacked and injured a cameraman working for a local TV channel at Customs Chowk in Peshawar city (Peshawar, KP).

On January 13th, farmers attempted to clear herders from their farms at Sani (coordinates for Kutum, North Darfur, used). Three vehicles with mounted machine guns arrived; in the ensuing attack, one farmer was killed and two were wounded. A further two were abducted.
On Jan 13, IS militants abducted and killed the Mukhtar of the al Musalamah village (Faisal Rashid al-Jamili) as well as burning his vehicle in al-Naimiyah, south of Falluja.

As reported on January 13, a person who was detained and forced to testify under pressure by the police during a meeting with his lawyer in Istanbul Police Headquarters in Fatih area. The lawyer was beaten up and taken out of the meeting room.

Pro-Hadi forces reportedly killed a citizen and injured another one for reasons that are left unclear by the source in Bayt Al-Qadi area of Al-Silw district in the south of Taizz governorate, southwestern Yemen.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: A woman was reported killed by pro-Houthi sniper fire in Al-Shaqb area to the south of Taizz city, southwestern Yemen.
On Jan 13, bullet ridden dead bodies of two Rohingya camp residents were found by the police in Cox's bazar (Chittagong). The culprits behind killings are unknown.

On Jan 13, an executive magistrate in Savar upazila (Dhaka) was allegedly assaulted by a mayor of BGB during the factory workers protest. It is alleged that the mayor gave order to shoot protestors which was protested by the magistrate, in return he was assaulted by the mayor.

On 13 January, a family was attacked by at least four people over a land dispute in Dhariwal Kaler village (Amritsar, Punjab). The group threw stones and bricks, and fired in the air. No injuries reported

On January 13, a group of around 50 Maoists abducted the nephew of a Block Pramukh (rural local president) in Phokhariya village under Haveli Kharagpur police station area (Munger, Bihar). They demanded the payment of extorsion.

On January 13, in Manappadaividu village in Palayamkottai Tehsil (Tirunelveli, TN), an unidentified person threw a petrol bomb at the residence of a contractor in an effort to hurt him because the contractor was holding a Pongal celebration in the area. There was no injuries or damage.

On January 13, a civil servant was assaulted by the minister for Internal Affairs and Planning in the latter's office at Janakpur city (Dhanusha district, Janakpur). The reason for the assault was for not selecting the Non-Governmental Organization preferred by the minister in receiving the conditional grant offered by the federal government for the entrepreneurship program.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Bantug, Umingan town, Pangasinan province on January 13, 2019.

On 13 Jan 2019, in Moo 7 village, Kabang tambon, Kabang district, Yala province, suspected separatists entered the house of two MP candidates of the Thai Nation Power Party, tied them up and shot them dead.
On Jan 13th, suspected ASWJ assailants attacked passenger transport vehicle in Ulumbi, leaving seven people killed.
13 January. Unidentified gunmen attacked an APC rally in Ilorin. A number of people sustained gunshot wounds and two people died.

13 January. Unidentified gunmen attacked the villages of Warwana, Tabkin Kwasa and Dutsi (in Gandi II district of Rabah, along the border with Zamfara - approximate coordinate used for the three locatios) on 25 motorcycles. 26 civlians were shot. Fatalities split between three locations.

On January 13th, gunmen ambushed a commercial vehicle at an unspecified location along the Nyala-Rokoro road. One civilian was killed and three wounded by gunfire.
On Jan 13th, soldiers assaulted a traditional leader known as Chief Sitauze at the Beitbridge Border Post. The soldiers did not believe he was a traditional leader.

On January 13, in Madurai city (Madurai, TN), police arrested and tortured a boy while interrogating him for an undisclosed crime. The boy died three days after his arrest due to serious injuries from the interrogation.

assoc_actor_1: Private Security Forces (Russia); Military Forces of Central African Republic (2016-)
notes: 11 January - 15 January. FACA forces detained a trader in Bambari, who was accused by locals of being an ex-Seleka member. The man was then taken to a FACA base, where Russian mercenaries, believed to be from the Wagner group, detained and tortured the man using knives, chains, bricks and batons. The man was later freed by Internal Security Forces. The UN has launched an investigation.

On 13 January 2019, in Buthidaung Township, in Rakhine State, a pastor of Mro ethnicity went missing. According to International Christian Concern, the men who arrested the pastor are from AA. The pastor is also an activist in the Mro community. AA spokesperson denied the accusation.
QSD arrested 6 civilians in Hala Khas, Kleib, Hamad Assaf in Ar-Raqqa.
QSD arrested 6 civilians in Kleib, Hala Khas, Hamad Assaf in Ar-Raqqa.

On January 12, Fulani militiamen attacked the Dogon hamlet of Tibi (Sissiri) near Baye, villagers fled while the assailants torched houses.

On 12 Jan 2019, in Bukit Minyak (Penang), an agent supplying foreign workers was found dead with 14 stab wounds in his house. It is unknown who killed the man, but it could have been due to unpaid wages.
12 January. Unidentified armed group attacks two young men, shooting one in the leg and stealing their possessions in Daka neighborhood of Labe.
12 January. A fisherman was shot dead by a herder in Agadama community

As reported in January 12, a prisoner was subjected to physical attack of the Gendarmerie commander after she refused to be treated with handcuffs on during her medical exam in Okmeydani Hospital in Sisli, Istanbul.

On Jan 12, in Barisal city, five policemen assaulted a journalist in Barisal city when he was capturing photos of a scuffle between policemen and a rickshaw driver carrying wheat bags with government logo.
On 12 January, a 19 year old Dalit girl was gang raped by three men and left in a field, in Barabanki district (Uttar Pradesh). She died of her injuries on 14 Jan.

On 12 January, unidentified persons believed to be linked to a transport union assaulted a member of a rival union in Parwanoo town (Solan, Himachal Pradesh) with rods, leaving three people injured. There have been recent clashes over authority in the local canter union.

On 6 January, a priest at Mansa Purni Hanuman temple near the Kalka-Parwanoo barrier near Kalka (Panchkula, Haryana) was murdered after the temple was closed for the night. He was struck over the head with a brick, killing him, and his valuables were not taken. No known motive.

While no motive is known, police speculate it was over an old enmity related to his criticism of labour contractors in the area and other anti-social elements.

Around 6 January, three men set fire to a 16 year old boy, severely injuring him, apparently after the boy had demanded money for a broken mobile phone, in Ghaziabad (Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh). Police registered a case under the SC/ST act, though it is not clear what caste the boy belongs to.

On January 6, one person died and two others were seriously injured after being shot at by four armed men in the Alamganj Colony in Patna city (Patna, Bihar). The reason behind the attack was a dispute over two bighas of land between two rival groups.

On January 6, a 26-year-old woman accused a ward chairman of sexually abusing and attempting to rape her in Narasingh Rural Municipality near Inaruwa city (Sunsari district, Koshi). The victim has lodged complaint at the rural municipality, while the accused denied of any wrongdoing.

notes: 01 January. Imbonerakure tortured a 14 year old boy, who was a CNDD-FDD member, in Kigoma, in an attempt to get the boy to confess to raping a child. They later took the boy to the police.
01 January. Members of the Nigerian army nearly lynch two girls over phone theft in Lagos

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 - 31 January. During the month of January, 44 people from the Kiwanja area were kidnapped, including 11 children. The abductions are carried out by armed groups and criminals who seek ransoms. Most of the abductions target women. Coded as one VAC event each week of January.
January (month of). Two gendarmerie and a police officer accused of torturing and abusing people arrested at in Bemarivo gendarmerie of Ambato Boeni. A girl was also raped.

assoc_actor_2: Fulani Ethnic Group (Burkina Faso); Pastoralists (Burkina Faso)
notes: On January 1, the Koglweogo killed 19 members of the Fulani community in the villages of Biguele and Kassaye, fatalities split between events.

assoc_actor_2: Fulani Ethnic Group (Burkina Faso); Pastoralists (Burkina Faso)
notes: On January 1, the Koglweogo killed 13 members of the Fulani community in the village of Boundoussi in Barsalogho (coded as Barsalogho at geoprecision 2).

assoc_actor_2: Fulani Ethnic Group (Burkina Faso); Pastoralists (Burkina Faso)
notes: On January 1, the Koglweogo killed 17 members of the Fulani community in the village of Dake.

actor1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie
assoc_actor_2: Fulani Ethnic Group (Burkina Faso); Pastoralists (Burkina Faso)
notes: On January 1, presumed gendarmes executed four men in the village of Inata and five others at the Kousoumbaka artisanal mining site a few kilometers away.
A village councilman was shot and killed by unidentified assailants at Barangay Batobalani, Paracale town, Camarines Norte province on December 31, 2018.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Barangay Muzon, San Jose del Monte City, Bulacan province on December 31, 2018.
A village chairman was killed by unidentified armed assailants at Abra province area on December 31, 2018.

On Dec 31, two members of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) were injured in Chittagong city in an attack by rival BCL men armed with sharp weapons over an alleged altercation at a polling centre the day before.
On Dec 31, a mother of four was gang-raped in Subarnachar (Noakhali, Chittagong) allegedly by 10 to 12 Awami League activists. The woman alleged that she was raped because she did not vote for AL.
On December 31, in Chennai city (Chennai, TN), a police constable who was intoxicated attacked a person sleeping on a pavement, leaving the person hospitalized.
On December 31, in Nagpur city (Nagpur, Maha), six armed actors stabbed a youth to death over establishing supremacy.
On December 31, a local BJD leader was shot dead by unidentified armed men near College Chhak in Asika city (Ganjam, Odisha).

On December 31, a 19-year-old student was attacked with rods and his head crushed with a stone by seven men near a petrol pump in Bhabua town (Kaimur, Bihar). According to the police, the attack was caused by a fight for supremacy between two groups in the area.

On December 31, a villager was stabbed by the cousins of a neighbour whose citizenship was challenged by the former at an NRC (National Register of Citizens) Seva Kendra (service centre) in Narayanpur village part II (Hailakandi, Assam). The victim had claimed his neighbour was a Bangladeshi.
On December 31, in Nagpur city (Nagpur, Maha), six armed persons stabbed a youth to death over establishing supremacy in the area.

On December 31, unidentified armed men shot dead an employee of the Karachi Metropolitan Corporation (KMC) in Azizabad area of Gulberg town (Karachi, Sindh) in a suspected politically motivated targeted attack.

actor1: Islamic State (Greater Sahara) and/or Ansaroul Islam
notes: On December 31, Ansaroul Islam and/or ISGS militants attacked a compound where customs officers and civilians celebrated New Year, a civilian was killed and customs officer wounded, the compound ransacked, and two vehicles burned.
On December 31, two women attempted to assassinate and wounded the brother of an imprisoned MSCD/DPF member, presumably in revenge for an attack against a family back in 2015.
On 31 December, mobs armed with pangas stabbed a man to death at his home in Nkhata bay on New Year's Eve because he was an albino.

On 31 Dec, a Somali National Army soldier shot dead a rickshaw driver at Fanoole village in Kaaran district, Mogadisho. District police rushed to the scene and shot and killed the perpetrator (coded in a separate event). The incident was motivated by a dispute over extorted money.

On 31-December-2018, 6 Afghan civilians including a High Peace Committee negotiator were killed in operations which included an airstrike conducted by Afghan and NATO Forces in the Zurmat district of Paktia province.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: One woman was reported killed and another injured by pro-Houthi sniper fire in the village of Al-'Ukaysh in Hays district, in the south of Hodeidah governorate, western Yemen.
QDW opened small arms fire in the air in As-Salamiyeh in southern Hama countryside in celebration of the New Years. 2 children were wounded as a result. No fatalities were reported.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 31 December. An unidentified armed group killed two women in Kasenga and stole their livestock.

On 31 December, 9 people allegedly supporting SAD attacked a Congress candidate in Rampura village (Amritsar, Punjab), beating him and his brother while also firing at them. It was apparently retaliation for contesting the panchayat polls, with the SAD candidates won.

Around 31 December, about 20 people opened fire on a man in his home in Manochahal Kalan (Tarn Taran, Punjab). The accused are associated with SAD and had apparently lost the recent panchayat elections and attacked him out of spite. At least one person was injured in the firing.
31 December. Police hit two young men suspected of illegal market trading with a machete while held in custody in Yaounde police station.

actor1: Police Forces of Egypt (2014-) Prison Guards
notes: On Dec 31 (or around), a prisoner allegedly died after he was left naked several days in Fayoum prison.
On December 31, gendarmes opened fire against a vehicle carrying a health worker and his driver in the village of Woulouwa, the health worker was severely wounded after being hit by three gunshots.

On 31 Dec, two assailants on a motorcycle shot and wounded a man at Gaheyr University village neighbourhood in Hodan district, Mogadisho. The victim was an electoral delegate in the 2016 Hirshabelle state parliamentary elections. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 31 December. A merchant, who belonged to the CNDD-FDD, in Ryamukona was beaten by police before they detained him and transferred him to an unknown location. The police alleged the man had possession of firearms, but locals report that the beating and arrest were done to avoid debts.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 31 December. A FNL-Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure in the Ruremba are of Nyakazi for being out past the curfew.
31 December. A notorious bandit in custody tries to escape Malagasy genarmerie and is shot dead in Tsaratanana.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On December 31, presumed BH militants attacked the village of Dabougoun, causing the population to flee.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On December 31, presumed BH militants attacked the village of Damaram and extorted a wealthy man.

assoc_actor_2: KNPB: National Committee for West Papua; Papuan Ethnic Group (Indonesia); Students (Indonesia)
notes: On 31 December 2018, more than 100 police and military personnel interrupted the student association of KNPB as they were organizing a prayer gathering to commemorate the group's fifth anniversary in Timika town, Mimika district, Papua. They arrested and beat nine KNPB members. They also destroyed their office in the process.
A drug suspected was killed during a police raid at Barangay Guadalupe, Cebu City, Cebu province on December 30, 2018. He was also on trial for murder.
On Dec 30, a 19-year old was shot dead by law enforcers at Rajghor Government Primary School, Brahambaria area on polling day.
On Dec 30, in Lakshmipur, one person was killed by unknown militants at Baralia Government Primary School in Dauutapara union (Sadar upazila, Lakshmipur).
On Dec 30, a Bangladesh Chhatra League leader was killed by unidentified armed men in polling day violence in Gazipur, Dhaka.

On Dec 30, an Awami League polling agent was killed by unidentified armed men, allegedly by supporters of opposition (independent) candidate, at Kundarpara Primary School centre of Shibpur (Narsingdi, Dhaka).
On Dec 30, unidentified armed men killed an activist of BNP in Gopalpur upazila, Tangail district on polling day.
On Dec 30, an AL supporter was killed in a knife attack by unidentified armed men at Shamash Khalsi High School Vote Center in Naldanga upazila (Natore) on polling day.
On Dec 30, supporters of BNP allegedly attacked and killed an Awami League supporter at a high school in Mohonpur upazila, Rajshahi.

On Dec 30, a voter from Khalaighat Ward No 2 under Lalmonirhat 3 constituency, was stabbed to death by unidentified armed men outside the Paglaghat Government Primary School polling centre when he went there to cast his vote.

On 30 December, several people assaulted a candidate who was elected sarpanch unopposed, in Kambo village (Tarn Taran, Punjab). The accused apparently attacked her home and car in a rage over the rejection of their nomination papers.

On 30 December, around 30 people allegedly fired at the newly elected sarpanch, her husband and supporters, after the declaration of panchayat voting results in Manakdeke village (Tarn Taran, Punjab). At least one person was injured in the firing.

On 30 December, two individuals broke into a home and thrashed the resident and his wife, as well as a neighbor who came to help them, in Jharunangal village (Amritsar, Punjab). Police say the attack was politically motivated as the victims' group had won the local panchayat polls earlier in the day. The individuals fired several shots in the air during the attack.

On 30 December, locals claim that a police team raided Chakfareed village (Ghazipur, Uttar Pradesh) a second time in two days, this time targeting Dalit homes, damaging property and threatening women.

On 30 December, two people were killed in an attack over a property dispute near Ram Choti Gangoli village in Kushinagar (Kushinagar, Uttar Pradesh). The two men had gone to cut a tree on the farm in question, when a rival group arrived and attacked them with lathis, sticks, and edged weapons.

On 30 December, unidentified individuals attacked and beat up a trade union leader in Nadawali village of Dera Baba Nanak (Gurdaspur, Punjab). His sister was a candidate in the local sarpanch elections. His leg was broken in the assault.

On December 30, a 37-year-old was attacked and killed by six unidentified men at the Hathgacchia area in Kolkata city (Kolkata, West Bengal). Sources believe the reason behind the attack is intra-party politics, though no party was mentioned.
On December 30, police assaulted and arrested a journalist in Bhimdatta Municipality (Kanchanpur district, Mahakali), while he was collecting news.
30 December. The body of a man was discovered in the Mubarazi river in Bugendana. The victim had been tied up with a rope.

actor1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: 30 December. UDPS gunmen assaulted FCC supporters to prevent them from voting at some polling stations in Kasai Oriental.

On December 30, in Tema town (Tema, Greater Accra), an unidentified armed actor killed the Senior Pastor of Tema Community Four Assemblies of God Church just before Sunday morning worship for unknown reasons.
On December 30, Chadian gunmen abducted six Libyan citizens in the area of the Fuqaha intersection (coded as Al Fuqaha Gate 400 at geoprecision 2).
On December 30, unknown gunmen abducted two members of the Amamra tribe in the area of Dar Brak (coded as Brak at geoprecision 2), while they were travelling from Sebha toward Sirte.

On December 30, ISGs militants attacked a vehicle carrying marketgoers 35km east of Ekrafane (coded at approximate location as Ekrafane 35km E, geoprecision 2), the passengers were assaulted and stripped of a significant amount of cash.
On December 30, in Nding village (Barkin Ladi, Plateau), unidentified gunmen attacked and killed four persons traveling in a car back to their village. Motives unclear.

On 30 Dec, armed men from Dhulbahante-Barkad sub clan shot and killed two men from Dhulbahante-Ali-Geri sub clan at the outskirt of Balli-Dandan village north east of Buuhoodle. The incident is linked to previous killings of Barkad clan members by Ali-Geri members in Buuhoodle on 27 Dec 2018. The likelihood of possible retaliation or armed clash in the area was said to be high.
On or before December 30th, three people were burned to death in a house in the area of Kabo (coodinates for Audo Kabo, Central Equatoria, used). Motive unclear.

HTS manning a checkpoint on the outskirts of Tal Tuqan in eastern Idleb countryside stopped a bus and detained 16 males on board, claiming their intent to flee to regime-held areas to carry out reconciliation with the regime and settle in its areas of control.
Unidentified gunmen shot and wounded 1 young man in Bennsh in Idleb. No fatalities were reported.

On 30 December, the son of a sarpanch candidate from Malha village (Tarn Taran, Punjab) was assaulted by supporters of a rival candidate, allegedly for opposing a 'cash for vote' scheme run by that candidate.

On 30 Dec, Habargedir clan militias shot dead at least two people from Hirshabelle administration at Baanyaaley (north east of Beletweyne) in Hiiraan region. The victims were from Maxaas district and were on their way to Beletweyne. The clan militias took two bodies of the victims away and confiscated their vehicles and guns.
On 30 Dec, Al Shabaab fighters stole a vehicle near Buurhakaba district (south east of Baidoa) on the Mogadishu road and headed to Baidoa. The driver and passenger were abducted.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 December. Voters at the Lurhala school in Walungu became angry when a man in the polling center was urging others to vote for Shadary. A police opened fire to disperse the group, killing one man. The CENI president reported that a CENI technician was lynched by an angry mob because they thought he was tampering with a voting machine.

On 30 Dec 2018, unidentified assailants opened fire at the vehicle of the deputy commissioner of Mataban in Hiraan region. The commissioner had left Mahas town and was headed for Beledweyne when the attack ocurred. The commissioner and three of his security guards were killed in the attack. No-one claimed responsibility yet the perpetrators are suspected to be clan militiamen.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Barangay San Rafael, Davao City, Davao del Sur province on December 29, 2018.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Barangay Caballeroi, Palayan City, Nueva Ecija province on December 29, 2018.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Barangay Santa Arcadi, Cabanatuan City, Nueva Ecija province on December 29, 2018.
On 29 Dec 2018, in Pattani province, a woman was shot and killed in an attack by suspected Southern Muslim Separatists.

On 29 Dec 2018, in tambon Pado (Mayo, Pattani), an assistant to the chief of tambon Pado was shot and killed by a gunman (suspected separatist) hiding in front of his house. The assistant was known to be active in drug suppression. 1 fatality.

On 29 Dec, 30-40 suspected AL supporters armed with sharp weapons attacked the Jatiya Oikya Front candidate Md Matiar Rahman at the Harindia Alim Madrasa in Harindia village (Kotchandpur upazila, Jhenaidah). Four people were injured, three severely. Local people tried to help the victims and clashed with the attackers. Later the police arrived and rescued the JOP men.
On Dec 29, following an altercation, a local Jubo League leader was killed allegedly by Jamaat men with a sharp weapon at Gurolkhanin (Patiya upazila, Jessore).
On Dec 29, local correspondent of the Daily Noya Diganta was attacked by unidentified men in Sharupdaha area (Jessore, Khulna).

On Dec 29, four students were allegedly picked up by plain-clothed policemen in Farmgate area (Tejgaon, Dhaka city). The detainees have not been produced before a court and different law enforcement agencies denied the arrest.

On 29 December, several armed people, allegedly aligned with Congress, shot at a group of Revolutionary Marxist Party of India supporters who were campaigning in Daud village (Amritsar, Punjab). Three RMPI members were shot and injured, and at least one other sustained a blunt weapon trauma.

On December 29, around 30-40 motorcycle-borne Maoists attacked a BJP lawmaker's house, shooting his uncle dead and torching about a dozen vehicles in Sudi Bigaha village near Deo city (Aurangabad, Bihar). They also planted an IED at the house and accused the BJP leader of not returning Rs 5 crore taken during demonetisation for exchange.

On 29 December, police allegedly raided Chakfareed village near Ghazipur (Ghazipur, Uttar Pradesh), which is home to around 11 families associated with the Nishad Party. Residents claim police broke down doors, damaged property, and beat any men they found, after an officer was struck on the head and killed by a stone thrown during a Nishad Party protest in Ghazipur earlier in the day (coded separately)

On 29 December, a woman was publicly stripped and beaten by rivals of her husband, in Rapri village of Gopiganj Kotwali area of Bhadohi (Bhadohi, Uttar Pradesh). The woman and her husband apparently protested when the accused harassed her, leading the man and his associates to attack them. Sources differ on the exact chain of events, but the accused seemingly attacked the woman in her home several hours after the initial incident. A video of it went viral on social media.

On 29 December, a relative of the Congress candidate for sarpanch in Khalehra village was allegedly attacked and killed by five people associated with SAD while campaigning in the village (Khalehra, Amritsar, Punjab). Five people attacked the man with swords and sticks while he was campaigning door to door in the early morning, and he later died of his injuries.

On 29 December, three people were injured during a firing incident in Daud village (Amritsar, Punjab). The group, associated with the Revolutionary Marxist Party (india) were campaigning ahead of the local sarpanch/panchayat elections, when a group of alleged Congress supporters attacked them and fired on them. Two received bullet wounds and one a blunt object trauma.
On December 29, armed men of Junejo community attacked a Junejo family near Naudero town (Larkana, Sindh), killing a 10 year old boy and injuring his mother and brother.
On December 29, an armed man shot dead a local PTI leader near Mohallah Rangpura of Sialkot city (Sialkot, Punjab).
The body of a young man was found in al Hilaliyah area on the outskirts of Quamishli city in eastern al-Hasakeh countryside with 2 gunshot wounds to the head.
Unidentified gunmen assassinated using small arms fire 1 man in Mashikh area of Deir-ez-Zor.
Unidentified gunmen assassinated using small arms fire the chairman of the Deir-ez-Zor Legislative Council of the Deir-ez-Zor Civil Council north of Deir-ez-Zor city.
Unidentified gunmen stormed a currency exchange and money transfer office in Sarmada in northern Idleb countryside, killed the owner and robbed the office.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 29 December. Imbonerakure assaulted a FNL-Rwasa member in Gatabo for not contributing to the CNDD-FDD.
On 29 Dec 2018, unidentified armed men shot and wounded a female human trafficker at Sweeto area, Bossaso.

29 December. The NDC Renove attacked Kashuga and nearby settlements. They attacked areas known for their support of political opposition figures, displacing many locals, which prevented them from voting the next day.

29 December. The NDC Renove attacked Kashuga and nearby settlements. They attacked areas known for their support of political opposition figures, displacing many locals, which prevented them from voting the next day.
On 29 Dec, unidentified armed men shot dead a district branch chairman in front of his home at Koodka village area in Xamar Weyne district, Mogadishu. No group claimed responsibility.

assoc_actor_2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
notes: On December 29th, an armed group attacked an unspecified area(s) along the Yei-Kaya road. An unspecified number of UNMISS personnel (nationality unspecified) were reported to have been abducted, and held for ranson, whilst looting of civilian homes also took place. The two factions of the SSNMC (one of which has joined the current peace agreement, the other breakaway group which has not) accused one another of being behind the attack (for the time being, an UAG is coded).

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 29 December. Imbonerakure beat a CNDD-FDD member to death for not participating in communal work in Nyamirambo (no coordinates available), in the Masango area. The perpetrators were arrested but were released by the area chief.
29 December. Mayi Mayi Mwenyemali abducted three men near Bwesho (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security map). The perpetrators demanded a ransom.
On Dec 29, a group of Tokro inhabitants attacked Allokokro civilians, injuring 15 and putting fire to 10 houses following land dispute.

assoc_actor_2: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 29 Dec 2018, in Muang district, Nakhon Phanom province, a body, wrapped in brown sacks along with blocks of cement, was found on the shore of the Mekong River. DNA tests show that he was one of three exiled activists, associated with the anti-military red shirt movement, who disappeared in December from Laos.
29 December: In Keffa zone, Southern region, unidentified armed group attacked Kambata ethnic group. At least 10 killed.
A dead body was discovered. It unclear what caused the death.
A shooting took place with unclear motives. One fatality (a woman) reported.
A broadcaster was shot and killed by unidentified assailants at Barangay Poblacion, La Libertad town, Negros Oriental province on December 28, 2018.

An off-duty soldier in civilian clothes from the 37th Infantry Battalion was ambushed and killed by unidentified assailants in Cotabato City, Maguindanao province on December 28, 2018. His companion, also from the 37th Battalion, was wounded.

On Dec 28, a group of unidentified men, numbering 6-7, beat a journalist of television channel ATN Bangla with iron rod and hockey sticks while he was standing in front of his residence in Nabharan area, Sharsha (Jessore, Khulna) leaving him severely injured.

On 28 Dec, a local sarpanch and his supporters assaulted a school headmaster and teacher with stones and sticks at Hill Tack (Upper Dadoch) village in the Darhal area (Rajouri, J&K), after they refused to alter the sarpanch's date of birth on his school records. The victims were hospitalised following the assault.

On 28 December, a group of around 15 unidentified youth attacked a member of Youth Congress with knives and sharp weapons in Sector 46 of Chandigarh city (Chandigarh) when he went to get pizza with friends. They beat him and his friends before escaping. The attack was apparently over an old enmity.

On December 28, a 35-year-old land broker was shot thrice at Bada Ghaghra in Doranda area in Ranchi city (Ranchi, Jharkhand). The man died a day later at the hospital due to his injuries. The police believe the reason behind the attack was a land dispute.
On December 28, unidentified armed men shot dead a worker of the Mohajir Qaumi Movement (Haqiqi) in Jacob lines area of Jamshed town (Karachi, Sindh).

assoc_actor_2: PML-N: Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz; Former Government of Pakistan (2013-2018)
notes: On December 28, unidentified armed men shot dead the former city president of PML-N in Havelian city (Abbottabad, KP).
On December 28, unknown gunmen gunshot wounded the son of an army general in front of his residence in the Njari area of NDjamena.

28 December (on or around). Mayi Mayi Fimbo an Fimbo reportedly attacked eight villages in the Koki (no coordinates available) area, located in the Kalemie territory. A joint MONUSCO-humanitarian assessment mission to confirm the attacks and humanitarian need was unable to reach the area due to insecurity.
On December 28, in Accra city (Accra, Greater Accra), policemen attacked a journalist who was covering the BHIM concert, leaving him hospitalized.

assoc_actor_2: URD: Union for the Republic and Democracy
notes: On December 28, unknown gunmen opened fire against a URD delegation in Salakoira and wounded four including one severely.
On December 28, in Ado-Ekiti town (Ado-Ekiti, Ekiti), unidentified gunmen killed a councilor and PDP aide for unknown reasons.

On 28 Dec, armed men of Suleiman-Habargidir sub clan carried out revenge on Wagardhac-Marehan sub clan near Dhabad village north of Abudwak in Galgaduud region, killing one Wagardhac clan member and wounding others.

Unidentified gunmen opened small arms fire at the vehicle of a currency exchange office owner on the road to al Kharafi in Deir-ez-Zor whilst the owner was returning to Basira area from al-Hasakeh, and subsequently looted USD 150,000. Neither fatalities nor injuries were reported.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 28 December. APCLS looted motorbikes, money, and property in Kanyaminsindo (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Tracker map). They also abducted six men to carry the stolen goods.
December 28. A moto taxi driver is assaulted by a gendarme officer over theft, resulting in a "rampage" by other moto taxi drivers (coded as two separate events)
28 December: In Mirab welega zone, Guliso town, 5 civilians killed by bullets fired by Military forces of Ethiopia.
On or before December 28th, an unknown group attacked a convoy of civilian vehicles in the area of Jumbo (Central Equatoria), killing a bussinesman.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: On December 28, presumed Katiba Serma militants abducted a member of the Tuareg Imouchag fraction, accusing him of being GATIA.
A shooting took place with unclear motives. One fatality reported.

On 27 December 2018, in Chin Ma Wun Htaunt Village, in Kyauktaw Township, in Rakhine State, the Myanmar military attacked Chin Ma Wun Htaunt village with heavy weapons, destroying a villager's house and causing the villagers to flee.

On 27 Dec 2018, in Mukdahan province, a candidate of the newly established New Alternative party was shot and killed by unknown. Other party members suspect a local gang killed him as he was investigating a corruption case. 1 fatality.
On December 27, a CPI (M) state secretary was attacked at Bishalgarh city (Sipahijala, Tripura), while he was on his way back to Agartala from Gomati district during by-elections in municipal bodies.

On December 27, an argument broke out between a servitor and some policemen in Shree Jagannath Temple in Puri city (Puri, Odisha), over allowing entry to some visitors. The servitor claimed he was assaulted by the police.

As reported on December 27, four journalists from the Zee Tripura, a local TV channel of the state, were assaulted by unidentified men in the Railway Station at Udaipur city (Gomati, Tripura). The reason behind the attack is not reported.

On 27 December, the head warden at Pratapgarh district jail in Pratapgarh (Pratapgarh, Uttar Pradesh) was shot and killed by two unidentified gunmen on motorcycles while he was shopping for vegetables. No motive known, no further details.

On December 27, a 37-year-old was shot dead and his 50-year-old uncle injured by six to seven people at Dihbuchauli village in Jandaha area (Vaishali, Bihar), over a land dispute. Two land tillers of the same village were also missing after the murder.

On December 27, cadres of the Communist Party of India-Maoist (CPI-Maoist) beat up a Mukhiya (village head) and his son in Badgawan Panchayat under Khukhra Police Station area (Giridih, Jharkhand). They also set their SUV on fire.

On December 27, armed Kharoos Jatoi tribesmen opened fire at a group of another Jatoi tribesmen outside Mataroo Khan Kharoos Jatoi village near Shikarpur city (based on city line) (Shikarpur, Sindh), killing four individuals.
On December 27, presumed ISGS militants abducted and executed the imam in Bangao.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: 27 December (on or before). A Rwandan trader was apprehended by Imbonerakure in a Cibitoke market. The Imbonerakure beat the man and stole his money before taking him to the SNR police. The police then tortured the man before taking him to an unknown location.
December 27. Ambazonian seperatists attack Bangourain in Noun, killing one civilian and burning several homes in ongoing struggle.
27 December. Boko Haram militants kill one villager and kidnap others in Tarmoua of the far north.
On December 27, Fulani militiamen killed nine Dogon civilians between Derou-Na and Bargou (coded as Derou-Na at geoprecision 2).

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: On December 27, presumed Katiba Serma (JNIM) militants abducted a journalist between Nokara and Boni (coded as Nokara at geoprecision 2).
On December 27, Dozos detained and executed a mechanic and an electricity provider in the village of Dabali (coded as Balandougou at geoprecision 2).
On December 27, two women were gunshot wounded likely mistakenly while passing near the military camp in Bankilare.

On 27 Dec 2018, an armed man from Dhulbahante-Barkad sub clan shot dead a man from Dhulbahante-Baharsame sub clan near Tuulo-Qodax, Sool region following a dispute over land ownership. The incident resulted in the death of a bystander from Dhulbahante-Ugaadhyahan sub clan and injuries to two others.

On December 27th, gunmen attacked a vehicle at an unspecified location on the road between Pibor and Juba (coordinates for Pibor, Jonglei state, used, given the prominence of the (disputed) Boma State minister of information in the source). Three people were killed, and seven wounded.

On or before December 27th, South Sudanese gunmen (allegedly belonging the SSPDF) were accused on raping two women (one of whom was a 15 year-old girl) near Ngomoromo (Kitgum). The incident comes amidst incursions by South Sudanese forces into disputed border areas.

On 21 December, supporters of a Congress candidate allegedly assaulted a rival candidate for sarpanch in Jalalabad town (Fazilka, Punjab). Police say that the supporters demanded the man withdraw his candidacy, and though both are Congress candidates, the clash was over seniority and therefore which could contest the election.

On December 21, suspected Kuki Army militants kidnapped a Motor Grader Operator/Driver engaged in the construction of National Highway 102 B, between S Munhoi village and Panglian village, in the Singngat area (Churachandpur, Manipur). They demanded Rs 50 lakh of ransom. He was rescued on January 16, 2019, by Assam Rifles personnel. No information about the rescue has been reported.

Investigations found that the attacked on the Banunu were likely planned in advance and soldiers participated in the attacks on Bongende.
